me.taylorkelly.mywarp.platform.profile

Interface ProfileCache


  • public interface ProfileCache
    Creates or resolves Profiles from unique identifiers or player-names. Implementations are expected to be thread safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Profile> getByName(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> names)
      Gets the the Profiles for all given names, if such a Profile exists.
      com.google.common.base.Optional<Profile> getByName(java.lang.String name)
      Gets an Optional containing the Profile of the given name, if such a Profile exists.
      Profile getByUniqueId(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
      Gets the Profile of the given unique identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • getByUniqueId

        Profile getByUniqueId(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
        Gets the Profile of the given unique identifier. If the service is unable to find a name matching the identifier, the returned Profile might not have a name value and calls to Profile.getName() may fail.
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - the unique identifier
        Returns:
        the corresponding Profile

      • getByName

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Profile> getByName(java.lang.String name)
        Gets an Optional containing the Profile of the given name, if such a Profile exists.

        Since Minecraft usernames are case-insensitive, Profile.getName() may return a name with a different case than the requested one. The returned one is than guaranteed to have the correct case.

        Calling this method might result in a blocking call to a remote server to get the Profiles.

        Parameters:
        name - the name
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the Profile

      • getByName

        com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Profile> getByName(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> names)
        Gets the the Profiles for all given names, if such a Profile exists. If none of the given names has a Profile, an empty List will be returned.

        Since Minecraft usernames are case-insensitive, Profile.getName() may return a name with a different case than the requested one. The returned one is than guaranteed to have the correct case.

        Calling this method might result in a blocking call to a remote server to get the Profiles.

        Parameters:
        names - an Iterable of names
        Returns:
        a List with all existing Profiles
